description.narrative: Statistikbyrån i Mocambique, INE, har tillsammans med landets finansministerium utarbetat ett projekt 2015-2018 för att genomföra en folkräkning under 2017. Folkräkningen genomfördes under två veckor i augusti 2017, och motsvarar då den tidsserie med tioårsintervall som rekommenderas av FN:s statistikbyrå. En census är en av de största operationer som ett land kan genomföra i fredstid, och engagerar ett stort antal personer, både inom och utanför INE:s administration. Insatsen bedöms ha stor betydelse för möjligheten att producera adekvat och relevant statistik. Den genomförs av INE med tekniskt stöd från UNFPA. Denna beredning av stöd förordar ett tillägg på 25 miljoner SEK till folkräkningen utöver de redan beslutade 25 miljoner som betalades ut 2015. De extra medlen ska täcka en så kallad Post Enumeration Survey, en kvalitetssäkrande åtgärd som bör genomföras efter folkräkningen ägt rum. Medlen kommer också att täcka kostnaderna för datainmatning och publicering av statistik.

The co-financing of the census will contribute to the objective “Strengthened democracy and gender equality, and greater respect for human rights”. But it will also contribute to several other of the sub-objectives in the Swedish strategy, as many sectors are dependent on quality statistics, primarily - Strengthened capacity in civil society to work for transparency, accountability and greater respect for human rights - Increased transparency, with a particular focus on citizens’ access to information on political and public decisions - Stronger democratic institutions and increased capacity in public administration The budget is spread over a five year period 2015-2019. For 2015, the GoM has allocated 367,5 millions of meticais (8,5 mUSD). Looking at the distribution of the total budget by year, it can be seen that the bulk of the census funds are required in the year of enumeration (2017) when 59% of the budget will be needed. However, financing and a financing plan for 2016 and onwards is still pending. INE’s draft action plan and budget for 2016 has yet not been presented, and it is not possible to judge how the overall financing situation will look like for 2016. In the lack of a medium term expenditure framework, it is not possible to predict how the GoM will work with the financing of the project in 2017 and onwards.

participating-org.narrative: INE/Instituto Nacional de Estatisticas de Mocambique
INE/Instituto Nacional de Estatisticas de Mocambique

description.narrative: A fully-fledged census carried out and published, despite financial and administrative problems. This results in improved knowledge of main characteristics of the population in the country to better understand the relationships of population and development; updated, disseminated analysis of demographic and related socio-economic information at national and local levels and a system of demographic and socio-economic information in place (as expected results above). The contribution helped finance a large number of preparatory work, including the set-up of the census questionnaire, informing INE staff on methodologies on censuses, as well as the first GPS work before the cartography of the country was made. All this was done with major delays however. A specific results is the set of questions on financial inclusion that became a separate and new module to the census, which is expected to give more info on a "complete count basis" on the topic. (Not yet fully analysed and published.)
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
